pageConfiguration.description: These functions do not perform a secure delete of any sensitive data.

form.resetBiosOptionHelperText: Resets firmware settings including: Platform keystore, partition NVRAM, and partition configurations.
form.resetToDefaultsOptionHelperText: In addition to server settings, this option resets BMC settings, including: all BMC account data, all changed passwords, all policies, LDAP configurations, network addresses, and time of day.

modal.resetBiosHeader: Do you want to reset the server settings?

resetBiosSettingsList.item1: All manual settings will be deleted.
resetBiosSettingsList.item2: Partition configurations and the platform keystore may be recovered if backups exist.

modal.resetToDefaultsHeader: Do you want to reset both the BMC and server settings?

resetToDefaultsSettingsList.item1: All manual settings will be deleted.
resetToDefaultsSettingsList.item2: Partition configurations and the platform keystore may be recovered if backups exist.
resetToDefaultsSettingsList.item3: All BMC logs will be removed.
resetToDefaultsSettingsList.item4: Currently active sessions on all network interfaces will be disconnected.
resetToDefaultsSettingsList.item5: The BMC default account and password settings will be restored.

modal.resetWarningMessage: Resetting without shutting down the system might cause an unrecoverable error.
modal.resetWarningCheckLabel: Continue without shutting down the system

toast.resetBiosSuccess: Factory reset of server settings successful
toast.resetBiosError: Factory reset of server settings failed
toast.resetToDefaultsSuccess: Factory reset of BMC and server settings successful
toast.resetToDefaultsError: Factory reset of BMC and server settings failed
toast.restoreSuccess: Configuration restored successfully. Please reboot BMC

alert.serverMustBePoweredOffTo: Server must be powered off to:
alert.serverMustBePoweredOffToUpdateFirmware: Server must be powered off to update firmware

modal.switchRunningImageInfo: A BMC reboot is required to run the backup image. The application might be unresponsive during this time.
modal.switchRunningImageInfo2: Are you sure you want to switch to the backup image (%{backup})?
modal.updateFirmwareInfo: The BMC will reboot during the update process. The server cannot be powered on until the update is finished.
modal.updateFirmwareInfo2: The running image (%{running}) will be copied to backup. The backup image will be deleted.
modal.updateFirmwareInfo3: Are you sure you want to proceed with the update?
modal.updateFirmwareInfoDefault: The new image will be uploaded and activated. After that, the BMC or host will reboot automatically to run from the new image.
modal.updateFirmwareInfoPldm: The new image will be uploaded and activated. After this, the host must be rebooted.

toast.errorSwitchImages: Error switching running and backup images
toast.rebootStartedMessage: Successfully started reboot from backup image
toast.updateStartedMessage: Wait for the firmware update notification before making any changes
toast.verifySwitchMessage: Refresh the application to verify the running and backup images switched
toast.verifyUpdateMessage: Refresh the application to verify firmware updated successfully
toast.biosUpdateMessage: New BIOS Image will be accessible in 5 minutes. Do not turn the power

pageKeyClear.description: Securely clear sensitive data on the system

form.clearAllSetGenesisIPL: Clear all and set genesis IPL
form.clearAllHeperText: Clear all the sensitive data that is controlled by the platform firmware
form.clearHypervisorSystemKeyHelperText: This indicates the hypervisor to clear the system key.
form.clearOperatingSystemKeysHelperText: This indicates OPAL to clear the operating system Secure Boot keys.
form.clearSystemSecurityKeyHelperText: This incicates OPAL/PEF to clear the system security officer key.

modal.clearAllMessage: Any encryption keys contained in the selected data will be lost. System will not be able to decrypt any data that requires these keys.
modal.clearAllTitle: Warning: This operation is not reversible

pagePageNotFound.description: The requested resource could not be found.

pagePowerRestorePolicy.description: Configure power policy to determine how the system starts after a power disturbance.

policiesDesc.AlwaysOn: Always on - The system always powers on when power is applied.
policiesDesc.AlwaysOff: Always off - The system always remains powered off when power is applied.
policiesDesc.LastState: Last state - The system returns to its last on or off power state when power is applied.

pageRebootBmc.rebootInformation: When you reboot the BMC, your web browser loses contact with the BMC for several minutes. When the BMC is back online, you may need to log in again.

modal.confirmMessage: Are you sure you want to reboot the BMC?

pagePolicies.ipmiDescription: Allow remote management of the platform via IPMI. Tools such as ipmitool require this setting to be enabled.
pagePolicies.rtadDescription: This option enables or disables the Remote Trusted Attestation Daemon for host firmware
pagePolicies.sshDescription: Allow access to shell sessions via SSH, through port 22 on the BMC.

disableMessage.ipmi: Are you sure you want to disable @:pagePolicies.ipmi?
disableMessage.ssh: Are you sure you want to disable @:pagePolicies.ssh?

enableMessage.ipmi: Are you sure you want to enable @:pagePolicies.ipmi?
enableMessage.ssh: Are you sure you want to enable @:pagePolicies.ssh?

pagePolicies.vtpmDescription: Enabling vTPM makes a TPM available to the guest operating system.

pagePower.description: Set a power cap to keep power consumption at or below the specified value in watts

pageServerPowerOperations.immediateReboot: Cold – Server reboots without operating system shutting down; may cause data corruption

pageServerPowerOperations.orderlyReboot: Warm – operating system shuts down, then server reboots
